// TVs

    date: '2025-02-10',
    title: 'Home Theater Perfection',

  }]
}, {
  id: "12",
  name: 'Samsung QN90C 65-inch Neo QLED TV',
  brand: 'Samsung',
  category: 'TVs',
  description: 'High-end QLED TV with Mini LED backlighting, anti-glare screen, and exceptional brightness.',

  rating: 4.7,
  reviewCount: 876,

    resolution: '4K Ultra HD (3840 x 2160)',
    hdr: 'HDR10+, HLG',

  },
  pros: ['Exceptional brightness for HDR content', 'Excellent anti-glare screen for bright rooms', 'Great gaming features', 'Slim design with thin bezels', 'Good upscaling of lower resolution content'],
  cons: ['Blooming around bright objects on dark backgrounds', 'No Dolby Vision support', 'Tizen interface can be laggy', 'Expensive'],
  reviews: [{
    id: 1,
    user: 'BrightRoomViewer',
    rating: 5,
    date: '2025-01-15',
    title: 'Perfect for Bright Living Rooms',
    content: 'I have a very bright living room with lots of windows, and this TV performs amazingly well even during daytime. The anti-glare screen and high brightness make it possible to enjoy content at any time of day. Colors are vibrant and the contrast is excellent for an LED TV.'
  }]
},

sourcesContent:
// Additional mock products data for CompareGenius
const mockProductsPart2 = [
  // TVs
  {
    id: "11",
    name: 'LG C3 65-inch OLED TV',
    brand: 'LG',
    category: 'TVs',
    description: 'Premium OLED TV with perfect blacks, Dolby Vision, 120Hz refresh rate, and smart features.',
    price: 1799.99,
    rating: 4.8,
    reviewCount: 1243,
    image: '/images/products/lg-c3-oled.jpg',
    images: [
      '/images/products/lg-c3-oled-1.jpg',
      '/images/products/lg-c3-oled-2.jpg',
      '/images/products/lg-c3-oled-3.jpg',
    ],
    specs: {
      display: '65-inch OLED',
      resolution: '4K Ultra HD (3840 x 2160)',
      hdr: 'Dolby Vision, HDR10, HLG',
      refresh: '120Hz native refresh rate',
      processor: 'α9 Gen6 AI Processor 4K',
      audio: '2.2 channel, 40W, Dolby Atmos',
      os: 'webOS 23',
      ports: '4x HDMI 2.1, 3x USB, Ethernet, optical',
    },
    pros: [
      'Perfect black levels and infinite contrast',
      'Excellent viewing angles',
      'Great for gaming with 4K/120Hz and VRR',
      'Thin, elegant design',
      'Comprehensive smart platform',
    ],
    cons: [
      'Expensive',
      'Not as bright as high-end QLED TVs',
      'Potential for burn-in with static content',
      'webOS can feel cluttered',
    ],
    reviews: [
      {
        id: 1,
        user: 'MovieBuff',
        rating: 5,
        date: '2025-02-10',
        title: 'Home Theater Perfection',
        content: 'This TV has transformed my living room into a cinema. The perfect blacks make movies look incredible, especially in a dark room. The colors are vibrant without being oversaturated, and motion handling is excellent for sports and action movies.',
      },
    ],
  },
  {
    id: "12",
    name: 'Samsung QN90C 65-inch Neo QLED TV',
    brand: 'Samsung',
    category: 'TVs',
    description: 'High-end QLED TV with Mini LED backlighting, anti-glare screen, and exceptional brightness.',
    price: 1699.99,
    rating: 4.7,
    reviewCount: 876,
    image: '/images/products/samsung-qn90c.jpg',
    images: [
      '/images/products/samsung-qn90c-1.jpg',
      '/images/products/samsung-qn90c-2.jpg',
      '/images/products/samsung-qn90c-3.jpg',
    ],
    specs: {
      display: '65-inch Neo QLED (Mini LED)',
      resolution: '4K Ultra HD (3840 x 2160)',
      hdr: 'HDR10+, HLG',
      refresh: '120Hz native refresh rate',
      processor: 'Neo Quantum Processor 4K',
      audio: '4.2.2 channel, 60W, Object Tracking Sound+',
      os: 'Tizen',
      ports: '4x HDMI (1 eARC), 2x USB, Ethernet, optical',
    },
    pros: [
      'Exceptional brightness for HDR content',
      'Excellent anti-glare screen for bright rooms',
      'Great gaming features',
      'Slim design with thin bezels',
      'Good upscaling of lower resolution content',
    ],
    cons: [
      'Blooming around bright objects on dark backgrounds',
      'No Dolby Vision support',
      'Tizen interface can be laggy',
      'Expensive',
    ],
    reviews: [
      {
        id: 1,
        user: 'BrightRoomViewer',
        rating: 5,
        date: '2025-01-15',
        title: 'Perfect for Bright Living Rooms',
        content: 'I have a very bright living room with lots of windows, and this TV performs amazingly well even during daytime. The anti-glare screen and high brightness make it possible to enjoy content at any time of day. Colors are vibrant and the contrast is excellent for an LED TV.',
      },
    ],
  },
  
  // Cameras
  {
    id: "13",
    name: 'Sony Alpha a7 IV',
    brand: 'Sony',
    category: 'Cameras',
    description: 'Full-frame mirrorless camera with 33MP sensor, 4K60p video, and advanced autofocus.',
    price: 2499.99,
    rating: 4.9,
    reviewCount: 567,
    image: '/images/products/sony-a7-iv.jpg',
    images: [
      '/images/products/sony-a7-iv-1.jpg',
      '/images/products/sony-a7-iv-2.jpg',
      '/images/products/sony-a7-iv-3.jpg',
    ],
    specs: {
      sensor: '33MP full-frame Exmor R CMOS',
      processor: 'BIONZ XR',
      iso: '100-51,200 (expandable to 50-204,800)',
      autofocus: '759-point phase-detection AF',
      video: '4K 60p 10-bit 4:2:2, S-Cinetone',
      stabilization: '5-axis in-body image stabilization',
      storage: 'Dual card slots (CFexpress Type A/SD)',
      battery: 'NP-FZ100, approx. 580 shots per charge',
    },
    pros: [
      'Excellent image quality and dynamic range',
      'Impressive autofocus with eye tracking',
      'Great video capabilities',
      'Robust build quality',
      'Improved ergonomics over previous models',
    ],
    cons: [
      'Expensive',
      'Rolling shutter in video mode',
      'Menu system can be complex',
      'Limited touchscreen functionality',
    ],
    reviews: [
      {
        id: 1,
        user: 'ProfessionalPhotographer',
        rating: 5,
        date: '2025-02-20',
        title: 'The Perfect Hybrid Camera',
        content: 'As someone who shoots both stills and video professionally, the a7 IV is the perfect tool. The image quality is outstanding, autofocus is reliable and fast, and the video features are comprehensive. The 33MP sensor provides enough resolution for large prints while still maintaining excellent low-light performance.',
      },
    ],
  },
  {
    id: "14",
    name: 'Canon EOS R6 Mark II',
    brand: 'Canon',
    category: 'Cameras',
    description: 'Versatile full-frame mirrorless camera with 24.2MP sensor, 40fps burst shooting, and 6K RAW video.',
    price: 2499.99,
    rating: 4.8,
    reviewCount: 423,
    image: '/images/products/canon-r6-ii.jpg',
    images: [
      '/images/products/canon-r6-ii-1.jpg',
      '/images/products/canon-r6-ii-2.jpg',
      '/images/products/canon-r6-ii-3.jpg',
    ],
    specs: {
      sensor: '24.2MP full-frame CMOS',
      processor: 'DIGIC X',
      iso: '100-102,400 (expandable to 204,800)',
      autofocus: 'Dual Pixel CMOS AF II with 1,053 AF points',
      video: '4K 60p oversampled from 6K, 6K RAW external',
      stabilization: '8 stops in-body image stabilization',
      storage: 'Dual UHS-II SD card slots',
      battery: 'LP-E6NH, approx. 450 shots per charge',
    },
    pros: [
      'Excellent autofocus performance',
      'Fast burst shooting (up to 40fps electronic)',
      'Great low-light performance',
      'Effective image stabilization',
      'Improved battery life over original R6',
    ],
    cons: [
      'Lower resolution than competitors',
      'Limited touchscreen implementation',
      'Expensive',
      'Video record time limitations',
    ],
    reviews: [
      {
        id: 1,
        user: 'WildlifeShooter',
        rating: 5,
        date: '2025-01-30',
        title: 'Amazing for Action Photography',
        content: 'The R6 Mark II has transformed my wildlife photography. The autofocus is incredibly accurate at tracking birds in flight and animals on the move. The 40fps burst mode means I never miss the perfect moment, and the image quality even at high ISO is impressive. Well worth the investment.',
      },
    ],
  },
  
  // Fitness Equipment
  {
    id: "15",
    name: 'Peloton Bike+',
    brand: 'Peloton',
    category: 'Fitness Equipment',
    description: 'Premium smart exercise bike with rotating 24" touchscreen, automatic resistance, and Apple GymKit integration.',
    price: 2495,
    rating: 4.8,
    reviewCount: 2134,
    image: '/images/products/peloton-bike-plus.jpg',
    images: [
      '/images/products/peloton-bike-plus-1.jpg',
      '/images/products/peloton-bike-plus-2.jpg',
      '/images/products/peloton-bike-plus-3.jpg',
    ],
    specs: {
      display: '24" rotating HD touchscreen',
      resistance: 'Electronic, auto-follow capability',
      pedals: 'Delta-compatible aluminum pedals',
      weight: '140 lbs (63.5 kg)',
      dimensions: '59" L x 22" W x 59" H',
      connectivity: 'Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, ANT+, Apple GymKit',
      audio: '2.2 channel stereo speakers with 26 watts output',
      subscription: 'Requires Peloton All-Access Membership ($44/month)',
    },
    pros: [
      'High-quality construction and design',
      'Immersive classes with excellent instructors',
      'Auto-follow resistance matches instructor cues',
